questions.question: The teacher ………………… an explanation of his conduct.
questions.description: To call for is to demand.

questions.question: ………………… the doctor immediately.
questions.description: To call somebody in is to summon them.

questions.question: Julie ...................... us yesterday.
questions.description: To call on somebody is to pay them a brief visit.

questions.question: My grandfather cannot ………………… past events.
questions.description: To call up is to recollect.

questions.question: The publishers are planning to ………………… a cheap edition of their new dictionary.
questions.description: To bring out is to publish.

questions.question: She …………………. the orphan as her own child.
questions.description: To bring somebody up is to raise them.

questions.question: The question ………………… before the municipal corporation last week.
questions.description: If a question comes up, it is raised for discussion.

questions.question: They ………………… against the gross injustice meted out to them.
questions.description: To cry out is to protest loudly.

questions.question: The rope ……………….. while they were hauling up the pillar.
questions.description: If something gives way, it breaks or snaps.
